p: Age is a risk factor for the development of severe disease and death from DENV infection. Many studies indicate that the incidence of DSS was highest in children aged between 6 and 10 years, and younger children had a significantly higher chance of dying from their infection ( Anders et al., 2011). And may be due to reason that younger children have an intrinsically more permeable vascular endothelium and are therefore more prone to significant plasma leak ( Gamble et al., 2000).
